input_text:
Job Title: Channel Marketing Specialist

Location: Richmond, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
McKesson is an impact-driven, Fortune 10 company that touches virtually every aspect of healthcare. We are known for delivering insights, products, and services that make quality care more accessible and affordable. Here, we focus on the health, happiness, and well-being of you and those we serve – we care. What you do at McKesson matters. We foster a culture where you can grow, make an impact, and are empowered to bring new ideas. Together, we thrive as we shape the future of health for patients, our communities, and our people. If you want to be part of tomorrow’s health today, we want to hear from you.

We are seeking a Channel Marketing Specialist to join McKesson in Richmond, VA supporting our Medical Surgical fast-paced marketing team. As a Channel Marketing Specialist, you will play a crucial role in implementing and optimizing marketing campaigns across various online and offline channels.

This role is also responsible for executing marketing initiatives across multiple channels to drive brand awareness, customer and sales engagement, and revenue growth. The ideal candidate will possess a growth mindset, strong attention to detail, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic and collaborative environment.

Responsibilities: 

Assist in planning, execution, and optimization of marketing campaigns across various channels such as Digital Paid Media, WordPress and other Content Management Systems, Email, Direct Mail and other relevant channels. Assist in email and direct mail campaign setup, including list segmentation, template design, and delivery optimization. Work closely with internal and external partners, agencies, and vendors as needed to support campaign execution and achieve objectives. Stay informed about industry trends, competitive landscape, and emerging marketing technologies to identify new opportunities for growth and innovation. Other duties may be assigned as needed to meet Company goals. 


Requirements:  

Degree or equivalent and typically requires 2+ years of relevant experience. Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field preferred. Strong understanding of marketing tactics across various channels, including email marketing, social media, content marketing, paid advertising, events, and more. Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Positive attitude and a growth mindset, with a passion for continuous learning and improvement. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail and the ability to adapt messaging for different channels and target audiences. Strong analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data, analyze campaign performance, and make data-driven recommendations for optimization. Collaborative team player with excellent interpersonal skills. Creative thinker with a knack for generating innovative ideas and solving problems. 


At McKesson, we care about the well-being of the patients and communities we serve, and that starts with caring for our people. That’s why we have a Total Rewards package that includes comprehensive benefits to support physical, mental, and financial well-being. Our Total Rewards offerings serve the different needs of our diverse employee population and ensure they are the healthiest versions of themselves. For more information regarding benefits at McKesson, please click here.

As part of Total Rewards, we are proud to offer a competitive compensation package at McKesson. This is determined by several factors, including performance, experience and skills, equity, regular job market evaluations, and geographical markets. In addition to base pay, other compensation, such as an annual bonus or long-term incentive opportunities may be offered.

Our Base Pay Range for this position

$58,400 - $97,300

McKesson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. 

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history.

McKesson is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including job seekers with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to Disability_Accommodation@McKesson.com. Resumes or CVs submitted to this email box will not be accepted.

Current employees must apply through the internal career site.

Join us at McKesson!

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
